entry.title: The Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Planning (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 which prescribe fees payable to the Department of the Environment in respect of applications made under the Planning (Northern Ireland) Order 1991. The Regulations increase planning fees by approximately 2.9% overall.

entry.title: The Materials and Articles in Contact with Food (England) Regulations 2010
The Building (Approved Inspectors etc.) Regulations 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.) Regulations 2000 (S.I. 2000/2532) (“the 2000 Regulations”) and consolidate all subsequent amendments to those Regulations with minor amendments.

entry.title: The Building Regulations 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Building Regulations 2000 (S.I. 2000/2531) (“the 2000 Regulations”), and consolidate all subsequent amendments to those Regulations with minor amendments. The amendments include removing the requirement, where building work involves inserting insulation into a cavity wall, to submit along with a building notice a statement about the proposed insulating material. The Regulations also insert into Schedule 3 three new types of work that may be carried out under a self-certification scheme, and revise the list of bodies which are able to register persons for the purposes of self-certification. The three new types of work are the installation of cavity wall insulating material, replacement of roof coverings and installation of systems to produce electricity, heat or cooling by microgeneration or from renewable sources. The authorisation of this last category of work supports the implementation of article 14 of European Parliament and Council Directive 2009/28/EC on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources (OJ No. L140, 5.6.2009, p.16).

entry.title: The Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Licensing etc.) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for implementing Directive 2009/31/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 April 2009 on the geological storage of carbon dioxide (“the Directive”). They also make provision for implementing an amendment to Directive 2004/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2004 on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage (“the Environmental Liability Directive”).

entry.title: The Furniture and Furnishings (Fire) (Safety) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Furniture and Furnishings (Fire) (Safety) Regulations 1988 to substitute a test cover fabric specification.

title.div: The Non-Domestic Rating (Small Business Relief) (Wales) (Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Ardrethu Annomestig (Rhyddhad Ardrethi i Fusnesau Bach) (Cymru) (Diwygio) (Rhif 2) 2010

div.p: This Order comes into force on 1 October and it applies in Wales.
Daw'r Gorchymyn hwn i rym ar 1 Hydref ac mae'n gymwys yng Nghymru.

title.div: The Non-Domestic Rating (Collection and Enforcement) (Local Lists) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Ardrethu Annomestig (Casglu a Gorfodi) (Rhestrau Lleol) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2010

div.p: These Regulations make provision for the amendment of the Non-Domestic Rating (Collection and Enforcement) (Local Lists) Regulations 1989, following changes to the level of Small Business Rate Relief between 1 October 2010 and 30 September 2011, for certain ratepayers who meet the relevant conditions.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud darpariaeth ar gyfer diwygio Rheoliadau Ardrethu Annomestig (Casglu a Gorfodi) (Rhestrau Lleol) 1989, yn sgil newidiadau i lefel y Rhyddhad Ardrethi i Fusnesau Bach rhwng 1 Hydref 2010 a 30 Medi 2011 ar gyfer talwyr ardrethi penodol sy'n bodloni'r amodau perthnasol.

entry.title: The Home Owner and Debtor Protection (Scotland) Act 2010 (Commencement) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force the provisions of the Home Owner and Debtor Protection (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”) and is subject to the transitional and saving provisions set out in the Home Owner and Debtor Protection (Scotland) Act 2010 (Transitional and Saving Provisions) Order 2010. Part 3 of the Act came into force on Royal Assent.

entry.title: The Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (Fees and Frequency of Inspections) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Regulation and Improvement Authority (Fees and Frequency of Inspections) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (the principal regulations).

entry.title: The Home Owner and Debtor Protection (Scotland) Act 2010 (Transitional and Saving Provisions) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order makes transitional and saving provisions in connection with the coming into force of the provisions of the Home Owner and Debtor Protection (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Health and Personal Social Services (Quality, Improvement and Regulation) (2003 Order) (Commencement No.5 and Transitional Provisions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 29th October 2010, further provisions of the Health and Personal Social Services (Quality, Improvement and Regulation) (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 (“the 2003 Order”) as set out in Article 2 (3) and Schedule 1.

entry.title: The Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (Registration) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Regulation and Improvement Authority (Registration) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 which make provision in relation to the registration of certain establishments and agencies under Part III of the Health and Personal Social Services (Quality, Improvement and Regulation) (Northern Ireland) Order 2005. The amendments at Regulations 2(2) and 2(6) relate to the registration of the following descriptions of establishments and agencies —

entry.title: The Voluntary Adoption Agencies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These regulations are made under the Adoption (Northern Ireland) Order 1987 (the 1987 Order) and the Health and Personal Social Services (Quality, Improvement and Regulation) (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 (the 2003 Order) and apply to voluntary adoption agencies.

entry.title: The Devon and Severn Inshore Fisheries and Conservation Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for the establishment of the Devon and Severn Inshore Fisheries and Conservation District (article 3) and for the Devon and Severn Inshore Fisheries and Conservation Authority (“the Authority”) for that district (article 4).

entry.title: The Isles of Scilly Inshore Fisheries and Conservation Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for the establishment of the Isles of Scilly Inshore Fisheries and Conservation District (article 3) and for the Isles of Scilly Inshore Fisheries and Conservation Authority (“the Authority”) for that district (article 4).

entry.title: The New Woodlands School (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order is made under sections 2 and 3 of the Education Act 2002 and amends the New Woodlands School Order 2007 (“the 2007 Order”) to provide that the 2007 Order is extended until 30th September 2013.

entry.title: The Equality Act 2010 (Commencement No.3) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 96(9)(b) of the Equality Act 2010 (c.15) for the purpose of making regulations prescribing the manner in which the appropriate regulator must publish specific matters which are not subject to the duty to make reasonable adjustments.
